text:
In this video, you’ll see how to use the 
Organization page in AWS Control Tower.

This design puts the hierarchy of 
your entire Organization on a single

page that you can configure as needed, 
saving you time and steps, and making it

easier to understand the relationships, 
state, and status of your resources.

On this page, you can manage 
your entire organizational

structure from one place, quickly 
understand parent-child relationships of

organizational units (OUs) and accounts, 
and easily take action on groupings of resources.

To get started, let’s navigate to the 
Organization page from the dashboard.

This page provides us with a hierarchical
 view of our resources, including OUs,
nested OUs, and accounts.

Previously, these resources 
were on separate pages.
We can group or ungroup related resources.

We can also expand or collapse the 
view for every resource on the page.

We can also expand and 
collapse resources individually.

We can also filter our resources 
by a specific property.
Let’s show only enrolled accounts.

Next, we’ll display only 
accounts that are not enrolled.

Similarly, we can choose to display 
only registered or unregistered OUs.

This filter can apply to other 
states and parameters as well.
Let’s try displaying only suspended accounts.

We can also choose to display
 only OUs, or only accounts.

When we need to take action on an account 
or OU, there’s no need to visit a separate page.

Instead, the Organization page serves 
as a central location to monitor and take
actions on all of our resources.

Let’s take a look at the actions 
we can perform on this OU.

As you can see, we have the option 
to reregister or delete this OU.
Let’s see what we can do with this account.
Notice that we have the option to update it.
We also have the ability to create resources.
We can add an OU.
We can also create an account.
We can also enroll an existing account.

Let’s find an account that 
exists in our organization
but is not enrolled in AWS Control Tower.

To enroll this account, the OU it 
belongs to needs to be registered.

This can be done from the details page
 for the OU or from the Organization page.
Let’s return to the Organization page.
Here we can easily register the OU.
For our purposes, let’s move on.

Even when the hierarchy 
of resources is collapsed,

we can see the states of nested 
resources under a parent resource.
There are two columns for this.
One is dedicated to the OUs.
The other is dedicated to the accounts.

Without going to different pages, we can
 view, group and manage the resources
in our organizational structure.

You’ve just seen how to use the 
Organization page in AWS Control Tower.

You can learn more about this topic in 
the description and links for this video.
Thanks for watching. Now it’s your turn to try.
